GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Corticosteroid Shock Therapy
Short-term high-dose corticosteroid therapy for acute ocular inflammation or severe allergic reactions.
Vision Therapy
Improves eye movement, focusing ability, and visual coordination through a series of visual training and exercises, commonly used for conditions like amblyopia and strabismus.
Artificial Tears / Lubricant Eyedrops
Supplements or stabilizes the tear film to relieve dryness, foreign body sensation, and fluctuating vision.
Antihistamine Eyedrops
Antagonizes histamine-mediated itching and congestion to relieve symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis.
Antibiotic Eyedrops / Ointment
For the prevention and treatment of bacterial infections or corneal epithelial defects, reducing the risk of secondary infection.
IOP-Lowering Eyedrops
Reduces intraocular pressure by decreasing aqueous humor production or promoting outflow, used for glaucoma control.
Corticosteroid Eyedrops
Used in short courses to suppress anterior segment inflammation; requires monitoring of intraocular pressure and recurrence.
Antiviral Eyedrops
For the topical treatment of viral infections such as herpetic keratitis.
Warm Compress and Lid Margin Cleaning
Improves meibomian gland blockage and lid margin inflammation through warm compresses and cleaning.
Intravitreal Anti-VEGF Injection
Inhibits abnormal vascular leakage and proliferation to treat wet AMD and macular edema.
Retinal Laser Photocoagulation
Uses laser coagulation to seal tears or ablate ischemic areas, preventing hemorrhage and detachment.
Laser Peripheral Iridotomy
Creates a hole in the peripheral iris to relieve pupillary block, preventing angle-closure glaucoma attacks.
Phacoemulsification Cataract Surgery
Improves vision by emulsifying and removing the cloudy lens and implanting an artificial intraocular lens.
Retinal Reattachment Surgery
Restores retinal attachment using methods such as vitrectomy, scleral buckling, or gas tamponade.
Ptosis Repair Surgery
Corrects ptosis (drooping eyelid) through surgery to improve vision and appearance.
Vitrectomy
Surgical removal of the vitreous to treat retinal detachment, hemorrhage, or macular diseases.
